Key Arguments: The proposed bill violates human rights, particularly freedom of speech and political communication.
The bill represents government overreach and a power grab to silence dissenting opinions.
Labeling information as misinformation or disinformation is a form of censorship and control.
The bill could lead to a two-tiered society, further dividing the population.
The bill assumes individuals are incapable of discerning truth from falsehood, which is condescending.
The bill excludes government bodies and mainstream media from accountability, creating a double standard.
The bill could stifle open debate and lead to increased mental health issues and societal division.
Notable Quotes: To use this time of fear and panic to justify this power grab to silence opposition is not only unconscionable, unjustifiable and unnecessary, it seeks to violate rights that have been upheld in the high court.
This bill is repugnant to freedom of speech in that it excludes the speech of some from being persecuted through the lens of mis/disinformation.
This is a completely unacceptable, anti-democratic, human rights abusing step towards a totalitarian society that Stalin, Mao and Hitler would be proud of.
This bill is a continuation of the harmful and shameful addiction that our government and unelected bureaucrats appear to have in controlling the population.
